info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 23 at 10:39AM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero through this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, until 3 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 11 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday afternoon through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
